derivation.yuyuan_name: late 18th cent. (in sense 2): perhaps from a variant of the verb ruffle, influenced by ripple

entry.def: If you riffle through the pages of a book or riffle them, you turn them over quickly, without reading everything that is on them.

example.ex: I riffled through the pages until I reached the index.

means.word_mean: 1. a small wave on the surface of a liquid
2. shuffling by splitting the pack and interweaving the two halves at their corners
2. look through a book or other written material;
3. stir up (water) so as to form ripples
4. shuffle (playing cards) by separating the deck into two parts and riffling with the thumbs so the cards intermix
